etymologies: mid 18th century; earliest use found in The Universal Magazine. From French roussette kind of cat shark, kind of fruit bat endemic to Madagascar, variety of white grape grown in Savoy, the wine produced from this grape variety, uses as noun of feminine of Middle French rοusset, russet reddish

definitions: Any of various fruit bats constituting the genus Rousettus (family Pteropodidae); especially R. aegyptiacus, which occurs widely from Africa to South Asia.

notes.text: Roussettes are the only megachiropteran bats that use echolocation, using pulses that are audible to humans.

definitions: A cat shark of the family Scyliorhinidae; especially the lesser spotted dogfish, Scyliorhinus canicula.
Usually with capital initial. A dry white wine produced from Roussette grapes (also called Altesse grapes) grown in the Savoy wine region of eastern France.
